'''Lena Raine''' ([[wikipedia:Help:IPA|/ËˆleÉª.nÉ™/]] [[wikipedia:Help:Respell|LAY-nuh]] or [[wikipedia:Help:IPA|/ËˆlÉ›.nÉ™/]] [[wikipedia:Help:Respell|LEN-uh]])<ref>{{tweet|kuraine|1283492191231291392|lay-nuh or len-uh, either is fine I just don't like 'lee-nuh' cos that's "Lina" or "Leena" to me.|15 July 20}}</ref>, also known as '''Lena Chappelle''' or '''kuraine''', is a composer, producer, and video game developer who composed tracks for the [[Nether Update]], [[Caves & Cliffs|Caves & Cliffs Part II]], [[The Wild Update]] and [[Tricky Trials]].<ref>{{Mcnet|the-sound-scary|The Sound of Scary}}</ref><ref>{{cite|url=http://lena.fyi/|title=Lena Raine - Composer & Producer|website=lena.fyi}}</ref> She also made the music discs, [[Music Disc Pigstep|Pigstep]], [[Music Disc otherside|otherside]], [[Music Disc Creator|Creator]] and [[Music Disc Creator (Music Box)|Creator (Music Box)]]. All of these songs are featured in her albums ''[[Minecraft: Nether Update (Original Game Soundtrack)]]'', ''[[Minecraft:  Caves & Cliffs (Original Game Soundtrack)]]'', ''[[Minecraft:  The Wild Update (Original Game Soundtrack)]]'', and ''[[Minecraft: Tricky Trials (Original Game Soundtrack)]]''. Outside of Minecraft, [[Wikipedia:Lena Raine|Raine]] is known for creating the soundtracks of games such as ''[[Wikipedia:Celeste|Celeste]]'', ''[[Wikipedia:Guild Wars 2|Guild Wars 2]]'', and ''[[Wikipedia:Chicory: A  Colorful Tale|Chicory: A Colorful Tale]]''.

== Biography ==
Lena Raine was exposed to music at a young age through her participation in a youth choir and her father, who was a violinist.<ref name="osvinterview">{{cite|url=http://www.originalsoundversion.com/interview-composer-lena-raine-talks-celeste-soundtrack-working-in-game-audio/|title=Lena Raine talks Celeste soundtrack and working in game audio}}</ref> She was introduced to MIDI arrangement through a Sonic fan community, where she began recreating songs she already knew and then eventually creating original music.<ref>{{cite|url=https://super.magfest.org/mages-blog/interview-with-lena-raine|title=Interview with Lena Raine}}</ref> She attended Cornish College of the Arts and got a degree in music composition.<ref name="osvinterview" /> Raine is well known for her work on the soundtracks of ''[[wikipedia:Celeste (video game)|Celeste]], [[wikipedia:Deltarune|Deltarune]],'' ''[[wikipedia:Guild Wars 2|Guild Wars 2]]'' and  ''[[wikipedia:Chicory:_A_Colorful_Tale|Chicory: A Colorful Tale]]''. In 2019, she was nominated for a [[wikipedia:British Academy of Film and Television Arts|British Academy of Film and Television Arts]] award and won the [[wikipedia:American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers|American Society of Composers, Authors and Publishers]] Video Game Score of the Year.<ref>{{cite|url=http://www.bafta.org/games/awards/bafta-games-awards-nominations-winners-2019|title=BAFTA Game Awards winners 2019}}</ref><ref>{{cite|url=https://www.ascap.com/news-events/awards/2019/screen-awards|title=2019 ASCAP Screen Music Awards}}</ref> She is transgender.<ref>[https://web.archive.org/web/20200703171934/https://pinkfae.org/2015/09/03/interview-a-conversation-with-lena-chappelle/ Interview: A Conversation with Lena Chappelle] - PinkFae Gaming: September 3, 2015</ref>

== Official ''Minecraft'' soundtracks ==
*''[[Minecraft: Nether Update (Original Game Soundtrack)]]'' (June 14, 2020)
*''[[Minecraft: Caves & Cliffs (Original Game Soundtrack)]]'' (October 20, 2021)
*''[[Minecraft: The Wild Update (Original Game Soundtrack)]]'' (April 20, 2022)
*''[[Minecraft: Tricky Trials (Original Game Soundtrack)]]'' (April 26, 2024)
